article.title: DELETE /{db}/_user/{name}/ _session/{session-id}
article.description: Deletes a session for a user

introduction.paragraph: This request deletes a single session for a specified user. If the session is not assigned to the named user, the session is not deleted.

body.paragraph: This request does not have any required headers.
This request does not use query parameters.
This request does not use a message body.

unordered-list.list-item: 404 Not Found – Specified session not found for user

body.paragraph: This response uses only standard HTTP headers.
If the session is successfully deleted, the response has an empty message body. If the session is not deleted, the message body contains error information.
The following example deletes a session with session ID 6f03152a5b1cac1e3cf2f15f4f68e8f5202cb876, belonging to user chef123 in database named cookbook.
body.code-block: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Length: 98 Content-Type: application/json Date: Thu, 06 Nov 2014 00:14:25 GMT Server: Couchbase Sync Gateway/unofficial
body.paragraph: The following example shows the response returned when you attempt to delete a session that does not exist on the server.
body.code-block:
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found Content-Length: 40 Content-Type: application/json Date: Thu, 06 Nov 2014 00:30:09 GMT Server: Couchbase Sync Gateway/unofficial
{ "error": "not_found", "reason": "missing" }
body.paragraph: The following example shows the response returned when you attempt to delete a session that is not associated with the specified user.
body.code-block:
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found Content-Length: 40 Content-Type: application/json Date: Thu, 06 Nov 2014 00:30:09 GMT Server: Couchbase Sync Gateway/unofficial
{ "error": "not_found", "reason": "missing" }
